result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:31 AM Defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere in court. Attorney Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared by video for Jasmine M. Lariviere. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF205 & 22CF111. 22CF205 set for arraignment. Information has been filed that mirrors complaint. Apollo as received copy of information - waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Apollo will be filing motions - would like to set out 60 days. Apollo may appear by video at next appearance. Sowinski has complied with victim rights. Motions to be filed within 60 days. Bond continued. adj. 11:36 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
State's

3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared by video for Jasmine M. Lariviere. Apollo in receipt of information - enters pleas of not guilty. Schiek states can get discovery out. Defendant may appear by video at next appearance. Apollo statement to motion filed for bond modification - Defendant on probation hold - will have revocation hearing. Schiek has reviewed - statement to bond.  Court adjusts cash bond down. adj. 03:46 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared by video for Jasmine M. Lariviere. Defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere appeared by video, in custody from ONSO.  Court questions Atty Apollo. Atty Apollo waives hearing.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bond continued.  Atty Pfeifer asks for separate arraignment.  Court sets over to May 23rd at 3;30 p.m.  adj. 2:14 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
